messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
911, please, fire ambulance. Uh, police.
This is 9-1-1. What is the address of the emergency?
This is Dale Ford. Fast record 211 North 7th. I've called a burglar in my shop.
211 North 7th?
211 North 7th. I got him gun down right now. Got a gun on him. He's here in my shop.
Are you there?
I'm here.
You stay on the line with me.
Okay.
All right. I fired a couple of shots at him, but he's here in my shop.
Did you hit him?
He said I hit him in his arm. It's just a .22.
What is your name?
Dale Ford, 211 North 7th.
I want you to stay on the line with me. Are you hurt in any way?
No, I'm not. And he said I hit him in his arm. I'm talking to him. He's hit in the arm.
The intruder, you shot at him and hit him in the arm?
Yes, it's just a .22, so he's mostly okay. He's laying on the floor.
I've already dispatched an ambulance. I want you to stay on the line with me in case something happens before they arrive. Okay? Is there anyone else there with him?
No. He said he was in here looking for his brother.
Do we know where the brother is?
No. I think he's just telling stories.
Okay, so there's possibly someone else?
He mentioned his brother Charles. I got broken into a week ago and some stuff got stolen, so I've been sleeping down here.
There is an officer on scene.
Okay, I'm sitting here in the door.
Just stay on the line with me until you see the officer, but do not point the gun towards them, okay?
Okay, I'm laying it down. He's on me.
Officer, I'm up here in this doorway. I got some new cars in the lot.
He doesn't see me.
Can he see you now?
I'm up here in the doorway at the shop. I'm talking to the dispatcher on the line.
I got the dispatcher on the line. I'm right here. I got the burglar inside here. I laid the gun on my desk.
Okay, stay where you are. Let me know if anything changes.
I hit him in the arm, okay? I'm still talking to him. He's trying to run away on me.
The officer's here.
Okay, I'm going to let you go. Thank you.
